page.title: 18ST. KATHERINE'S CHURCH
page.content: CHISELHAMPTON When the parish was united with Stadhampton in the mid 1970's this church was declared redundant on 1st. February 1977. It is in the care of the Redundant Churches Fund. A key is kept by the owner of Church Farm so that visitors can have access. Services can be held with special permission. At present the church is closed for repair to roof and bell turret. It is a fine example of an C18 country church and remains largely unaltered. Most of the fittings inside are original. 30 years ago the clock faces on the three sides of the bell turret were repainted light blue with gold Roman numerals and scrolls. They clearly show the date when the church was built ... 1762.
